attributes.additional_details: Each year Channel 4 works with around  300 creative companies across the UK to develop incredible programmes like recent dramas Help, It's a Sin and current affairs show Unreported World and has helped develop the UK’s creative sector into a global force. its unique model - commercially-funded but with a public benefit remit – allows the Channel to commission programmes that showcase Britain in all of its diversity and its privatisation would seriously undermine this and must be stopped.
attributes.background: Channel 4 is under threat. The government plans to sell the publicly  owned channel to a private buyer. This will seriously damage the creative sector, affecting how much the channel spends in different UK regions - undermining its remit to reflect interests of different communities across the UK.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/613995
